name: GetPayGroupForJob
description:
Retrieve the pay group for a given job ID.

Use this tool to obtain the pay group associated with a specific job ID from the Workday service. This is useful for payroll management and operations.

parameters.name: workday_resource_id
parameters.description: The Workday ID associated with the specific job to retrieve its pay group. This is required for identification.

value_schema.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

parameters.name: effective_date
parameters.description: The effective date of the pay group in yyyy-mm-dd format.

value_schema.description: The effective date of the pay group, using the date format yyyy-mm-dd.

parameters.name: max_objects_per_response
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of objects to return in the response. Default is 20; maximum is 100.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: response_offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in the response. Default is 0. Use with 'response_limit' for paging.

value_schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Workday API

parameters.name: effective
parameters.description: The effective date of the pay group, using the date format yyyy-mm-dd.

value_schema.description: The effective date of the pay group, using the date format yyyy-mm-dd.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

value_schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

value_schema.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
